intro: Vachellia leucospira, commonly known as the white thorn acacia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences, and its leaves are bipinnate, consisting of numerous tiny leaflets. Vachellia leucospira is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often found in savannas and rocky soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
